files.description: CLI tool that generates Markdown documentation from schema.json and optionally regenerates schema stubs from documented examples to keep schema and docs in sync.

CLI validator that discovers benchmark output JSON files, validates them against outputs/schemas/benchmark_schema.json, and fails with actionable error messages when violations or deprecated ad-hoc formats are found.
Shared policy module that defines allowed output file patterns, deprecated legacy/ad-hoc patterns, and mapping rules to schema versions used by the validator and CI/pre-commit hooks.
Utilities for loading JSON Schema, resolving local $ref pointers, and running Draft 2020-12 validation with stable, readable error reporting.
Generated documentation describing the benchmark output schema, required fields, examples, and migration notes for deprecated ad-hoc formats.
Pre-commit configuration that runs benchmark output validation and blocks commits introducing invalid or deprecated benchmark output files.
GitHub Actions workflow that validates all benchmark outputs against schema.json on pull requests and pushes as a required CI gate.
Project configuration defining the tools package, dependencies (including jsonschema), and runnable console scripts for docs generation and validation.
Test suite covering schema validation success/failure cases, deprecated format detection, and deterministic error output for the validator CLI.
Representative valid benchmark output JSON fixture that conforms to outputs/schemas/benchmark_schema.json for validator and doc generation tests.
Representative deprecated/ad-hoc benchmark output JSON fixture used to verify the validator blocks legacy formats not represented in schema.json.

missionDescription: Generate docs from schema (or vice versa), enforce schema validation as a pre-commit/CI gate for all benchmark outputs, and deprecate any ad-hoc formats not represented in schema.json.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete the urgent task identified by Meta-Coordinator

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Elevates schema/spec to the single source of truth, preventing drift between docs, code, and outputs and enabling stable downstream tooling (validators, runners, likelihood builders)....
